intro: Atractocarpus fitzalanii subsp. tenuipes, commonly known as the slender-leafed tamarind, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It produces edible, woody pods containing seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a food source. The subspecies tenuipes is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to other subspecies of Atractocarpus fitzalanii.
